events.1672: A French squadron under De la Haye encountered a fleet of the Dutch, who were in hostility with the French, near Cape Comorin.
events.1829: Kittur Rani Channamma, revolutionary freedom fighter and social reformer, passed away.
events.1878: Mother-Pondicherry, greatest world teacher, was born in Paris.
events.1894: Dr. Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar, famous scientist, was born at Bhera, Punjab.
events.1899: Suryakant Tripathi `Nirala', famous Hindi poet, was born.
events.1952: The XV Indian Olympic Games in Madras.
events.1953: Tillaya Dam and Bokaro Power Station opened by the PM.
events.1959: Press Club of India was founded in New Delhi.
events.1973: V. R. Sonalkar was appointed as the Narcotics Commissioner of India. He headed this office till 31-07-1974.
events.1979: Yousuf Hussain, litterateur and brother of President Zakir Hussain Khan, passed away.
events.1983: More than 600 people were killed in the Indian state of Assam after student agitators protesting the immigration of Muslim refugees from Bangladesh attempted to stop state elections.
events.1987: Pakistan President Gen. Zia visits India.
events.1990: The Bombay Sappers join the club of the select few, who received colours from the President of India (21-2-90).
events.1991: Nutan, famous film actress, died at the age of 56 years.
events.1992: Congress scores nearly three-fourth majority in Punjab Assembly elections.
events.1993: Naxals free Andhra Pradesh Congress (I) MLA P.Balaraju and a govt. official after 22 days in captivity.
events.1995: The plan outlay for Andhra Pradesh for 1995-96 fixed at Rs. 3.159 crores.
events.1996: Japanese encephalitis', caused by virus transmitted by mosquitoes, claims 21 lives in Kerala.
events.1997: Sonic Multani bags National snooker title in Mumbai.
events.1998: Romesh Bhandari, U.P. Governor,  dismisses the Kalyan Singh Government and inducts an 18-member ministry headed by Jagadambika Pal of the Loktantrik Congress Party. BJP moves the Allahabad High Court. BJP's Prime Ministerial candidate, A. B. Vajpayee, goes on a "fast-unto-death".
